column4: hello all.  ahve a question for you.  just rendered my os (vista) unusable.  I enlarged the partition, then could't boot from it.  i've tried everything.  and my question is, if i install vista on another partition (install it again), will I be able to browse my primary partition from there, transfer my data to my new vista os, and save the day?

the reason why i am in this forum is because I am also an ubuntu user.  I use a dual boot, but had to erase the ubuntu partition too, because i've messed up my system.  so now i want to recover data, and reinstall.
sunbird...no
ubuntu-vista dual boot.  then i resized vista (enlarged it.  then I reinstalled ubuntu.  now, my computer won't boot to anything.  nothing loads.
this may be worth a look:  http://www.sysresccd.org
that link I provided should do that
a live cd is what it is
Using  sudo fdisk -l  , find the NTFS device name, then mount it (e.g.    mkdir /mnt/vista && mount /dev/sda1 /mnt/vista  )
try that if you haven't first^
I wouldn't try repartitioning until you have a backup
possibly
if you want to pastebin the  sudo fdisk -l  results, it may help
pastebin the output of  sudo fdisk -l  please?
fair enough
np
I gave those instructions :)
np
ohh, I get the same, sorry
yup
try    sudo mkdir /mnt/vistamnt    then    sudo mount /dev/sda1 /mnt/vistamnt    (change /dev/sda1 to your vista/ntfs device name, you can use something else in place of vistamnt too if you like)
getting there. the last command you tried will need a sudo infront also, but as the error states, it may be dangerous
was about to say it's probably your only option :)
you happily backing up now?
